SpecialEvent Class Reference

#include <SpecialEvent.h>

Inheritance diagram for SpecialEvent:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A special event, e.g.

select all or backspace, usually raised by the keyboard. The input handling of the adapter instantiates this class and adds them to the desktop's event queue by using its addEvent() method.

See also:
Desktop::addEvent()

Definition at line 21 of file SpecialEvent.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Type
 

Enumeration values:
EVENT_NONE  No event.

EVENT_BACK_SPACE  The BACKSPACE key (backward delete) has been pressed.

EVENT_BACK_TAB  The primary back TAB combination has been pressed.

On Windows systems, this is SHIFT+TAB. Primary back tabs step the focus from field to field in backward order.

EVENT_CANCEL  The cancel event.

On Windows systems, this is the ESC key.

EVENT_COPY  The clipboard copy event.

On Windows systems, this is the Ctrl+C or the Ctrl+Ins key combination.

EVENT_CUT  The clipboard cut event.

On Windows systems, this is the Ctrl+X or the Shift+Del key combination.

EVENT_DELETE  The DELETE key (forward delete) has been pressed.

EVENT_EDIT  The EDIT key has been pressed.

On Windows systems, this is the F2 key.

EVENT_ENTER  The ENTER key has been pressed.

EVENT_MOVE_DOWN  The DOWN key has been pressed.

EVENT_MOVE_LEFT  The LEFT key has been pressed.

EVENT_MOVE_TO_END  The END key has been pressed.

EVENT_MOVE_TO_START  The START key has been pressed.

On Windows systems, this is the HOME or POS1 key.

EVENT_MOVE_RIGHT  The RIGHT key has been pressed.

EVENT_MOVE_UP  The UP key has been pressed.

EVENT_PAGE_DOWN  The PAGE DOWN key has been pressed.

EVENT_PAGE_UP  The PAGE UP key has been pressed.

EVENT_PASTE  The clipboard paste event.

On Windows systems, this is the Ctrl+V or the Shift+Ins key combination.

EVENT_SECONDARY_BACK_TAB  The secondary back TAB combination has been pressed.

On Windows systems, this is SHIFT+CTRL+TAB. Back tabs step the tabbing area to tabbing area in backward order.

EVENT_SECONDARY_TAB  The secondary TAB combination has been pressed.

On Windows systems, this is CTRL+TAB. Back tabs step the tabbing area to tabbing area.

EVENT_SELECT_ALL  The user has requested to select all (e.g.

by pressing Ctrl+A on Windows systems).

EVENT_TAB  The primary TAB combination has been pressed.

On Windows systems, this is TAB. Primary tabs step the focus from field to field.

SpecialEvent (  bool  option1,
bool  option2,
int  scanCode,
bool  held,
bool  pressed,
bool  released,
int  repeats,
Type  type
) 
 

Creates a new special event with two options.

Parameters:
option1 Whether the option button 1 is currently pressed, e.g. on Windows systems, this is the SHIFT key.
option2 Whether the option button 2 is currently pressed, e.g. on Windows systems, this is the CTRL key.
scanCode The scan code of the key that caused the event.
held Whether the key is currently held down.
pressed Whether the key is newly pressed down.
released Whether the key has been released.
repeats The number of key repeats.
type The type of the special event.

Executes (handles) the event.

Reimplemented from KeyEvent.

virtual void executeOn (  EventTarget *  target  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Executes (handles) the event on a given event target.

The default implementation does nothing and returns false.

Parameters:
target The event target to execute the event on.

Reimplemented from KeyEvent.
